title: The Crime with Zero Possibility to be Proven

infobox.Title:: The Crime with Zero Possibility to be Proven
infobox.Japanese title:: 立証確率ゼロの犯罪  (Risshō Kakuritsu Zero no Hanzai)
infobox.Cast:: Conan Edogawa  Kazunobu Chiba  Kogoro Mouri  Juzo Megure  Wataru Takagi  Ran Mouri  Officer Tome  Female forensics member
infobox.Character design:: Masatomo Sudo  Junko Yamanaka  Chiharu Sato (sub-character)  Kumiko Shishido (design works)
infobox.Voice Cast::
Voice Cast:



Minami Takayama as Conan Edogawa  Rikiya Koyama as Kogoro Mouri  Wakana Yamazaki as Ran Mouri  Wataru Takagi as Wataru Takagi  Chafurin as Juzo Megure  Isshin Chiba as Kazunobu Chiba  Kaoru Shimamura as Kyoko Takahata  Atsuko Enomoto as Shiori Soejima (Shiori Takahata)  Keiichiro Satomi as Itsuro Soejima  Kyosei Tsukui as Naoya Nishitani

sections.Situation:
Kogoro, Ran, and Conan pass by a woman named Kyoko Takahata who passes out upon receiving a phone call that her brother-in-law, Itsuro Soejima, was found dead in her home.

They head to her house along with the police to discover that the drunk Soejima died when he fired a shotgun toward the ceiling, which caused a chandelier to fall on top of him.
The police conclude it's suicide, however Conan believes it was a carefully planned murder. Conan investigates and discovers that in half a year, there were nine incidents where Soejima almost died due to his alcoholism and that Takahata was involved in all nine incidents.
sections.People:
- 35 years old
- Mall customer
- Victim (crushed)
- 27 years old
- Shiori's husband
- Deceased (illness)
- Kyoko's younger sister
- Itsuro's wife
- 37 years old
- Recurring cat burglar
sections.Resolution:
Conan reveals that Kyoko Takahata called Soejima to her home and had prepared the alcohol and shotgun to tempt Soejima, who is a recovering alcoholic. As evidence, Conan reveals that a piece of her nail was found in Soejima's house and that she was searching for his cellphone which evidenced that she called him to her place.
Takahata confesses and reveals that she killed Soejima because she was sure that he caused the death of her beloved sister. Conan reveals that a message from her sister's phone reveals she died of an illness and that she loved Soejima very much, and that she asked Soejima to promise  her to go and apologized to her beloved sister when he become a better person, which he tried to. Takahata has a breakdown over said revelation.
